name: girl with Lord of refuge (bastet)
description:
Bast (its name is also spelled bast, baast, ubasti or baset, was the ancient Egyptian goddess of refuge and cat. She was the daughter of ra, the sun god. This goddess was venerated from the time of the second dynasty.
 
 The center for the worship was at per-bast (bubastis in Greek).
 
 Bastet is described as a woman with a tame cat head. However, up to 1000 B.C.E. it was portrayed as a lioness. When ra destroyed apep's enemy, bastet was usually pictured asa cat. When described as a cat, he was connected with the moon (his son khonsu was the moon god). When displayed as a lioness, she is linked to sunlight.
 
 Bast is fire goddess, cat, home guard and pregnant woman. According to one myth, it is the personification of the soul of ISIS. She was also referred to as "the daughter of the east ".
 
 Bastet, like a cat, has two sides of its personality, is tame and aggressive. He was gentle and gentle looked upon next to his duties as a home protector, anda pregnant woman, and was aggressive by her nature.
